Question: Can you provide the vehicle make and model involved in crimes occurring near location with postcode 'EC2M 7PY' that were investigated by Officer Jameson with badge number '7321A'?
Cypher:
MATCH (officer:Officer)<-[:INVESTIGATED_BY]-(crime:Crime)
MATCH (crime)-[:OCCURRED_AT]->(location:Location)
MATCH (location)-[:HAS_POSTCODE]->(postcode:PostCode)
MATCH (crime)<-[:INVOLVED_IN]-(vehicle:Vehicle)
WHERE officer.name="Jameson" AND officer.badge_no="7321A" AND postcode.code="EC2M 7PY"
RETURN officer, crime, location, postcode, vehicle, vehicle.make, vehicle.model
Corrected-Cypher:
MATCH (officer:Officer)<-[relation5:INVESTIGATED_BY]-(crime:Crime)
MATCH (crime)-[relation6:OCCURRED_AT]->(location:Location)
MATCH (location)-[relation7:HAS_POSTCODE]->(postcode:PostCode)
MATCH (crime)<-[relation8:INVOLVED_IN]-(vehicle:Vehicle)
WHERE officer.name="Jameson" AND officer.badge_no="7321A" AND postcode.code="EC2M 7PY"
RETURN relation8, relation7, relation6, relation5, officer, crime, location, postcode, vehicle, vehicle.make, vehicle.model
Rewrite: Could you supply the make and model of the vehicle involved in criminal activities near the area with the postcode 'EC2M 7PY' that Officer Jameson, who has badge number '7321A', investigated?

Question: What is the age and surname of individuals who have made calls longer than 10 minutes from phones registered under the postcode 'SW1A 1AA' and involved in a robbery case?
Cypher:
MATCH (caller_phone:Phone)-[made_call:CALLER]->(phone_call:PhoneCall)
MATCH (phone_call)-[long_call:CALLED]->(receiver_phone:Phone)
MATCH (person_caller:Person)-[has_phone_caller:HAS_PHONE]->(caller_phone)
MATCH (person_caller)-[lives_at:CURRENT_ADDRESS]->(caller_location:Location)
MATCH (caller_location)-[in_postcode:HAS_POSTCODE]->(postcode:PostCode)
MATCH (person_caller)-[party_to:PARTY_TO]->(crime:Crime)
MATCH (crime)-[crime_type:OCCURRED_AT]->(crime_location:Location)
WHERE phone_call.call_duration > 10 AND postcode.code="SW1A 1AA" AND crime.type="robbery"
RETURN caller_phone, made_call, phone_call, long_call, receiver_phone, person_caller, has_phone_caller, lives_at, caller_location, in_postcode, postcode, party_to, crime, crime_type, crime_location, person_caller.age, person_caller.surname
Corrected-Cypher:
MATCH (caller_phone:Phone)-[made_call:CALLER]-(phone_call:PhoneCall)
MATCH (phone_call)-[long_call:CALLED]->(receiver_phone:Phone)
MATCH (person_caller:Person)-[has_phone_caller:HAS_PHONE]->(caller_phone)
MATCH (person_caller)-[lives_at:CURRENT_ADDRESS]->(caller_location:Location)
MATCH (caller_location)-[in_postcode:HAS_POSTCODE]->(postcode:PostCode)
MATCH (person_caller)-[party_to:PARTY_TO]->(crime:Crime)
MATCH (crime)-[crime_type:OCCURRED_AT]->(crime_location:Location)
WHERE phone_call.call_duration > 10 AND postcode.code="SW1A 1AA" AND crime.type="robbery"
RETURN caller_phone, made_call, phone_call, long_call, receiver_phone, person_caller, has_phone_caller, lives_at, caller_location, in_postcode, postcode, party_to, crime, crime_type, crime_location, person_caller.age, person_caller.surname
Semantic-EQL-Question: Who made calls longer than 10 seconds from phones registered at the postcode "SW1A 1AA" and were also involved in a robbery?
Rewrite: What are the last names and ages of people who made phone calls exceeding 10 minutes from devices registered to the postcode 'SW1A 1AA' and implicated in a robbery incident?

Question: Retrieve the email addresses of persons living in the 'W1F 7LP' area, who are related to individuals charged with 'fraud' and own a vehicle made post-2015.
Cypher:
MATCH (person:Person)-[hasEmail:HAS_EMAIL]->(email:Email),
      (person)-[currentAddress:CURRENT_ADDRESS]->(location:Location)-[hasPostcode:HAS_POSTCODE]->(postcode:PostCode),
      (person)-[familyRel:FAMILY_REL]->(relatedPerson:Person)-[partyTo:PARTY_TO]->(crime:Crime),
      (person)-[owns:HAS_PHONE]->(phone:Phone),
      (vehicle:Vehicle)-[involvedIn:INVOLVED_IN]->(crime)
WHERE postcode.code="W1F 7LP" AND crime.charge="fraud" AND vehicle.year > 2015
RETURN person, hasEmail, email, currentAddress, location, hasPostcode, postcode, familyRel, relatedPerson, partyTo, crime, owns, phone, vehicle, involvedIn, email.email_address
Semantic-EQL-Question: What details are available for people living in "W1F 7LP" associated with fraud charges, who also have vehicles from after 2015, including their emails and family ties?
Rewrite: Gather the email addresses of people residing in the 'W1F 7LP' zone who are connected to someone accused of 'fraud' and possess a vehicle manufactured after 2015.

Question: List the names of officers who investigated crimes that occurred at locations within the 'NE1 4AD' postcode area, involving cars registered to the year 2019.
Cypher:
MATCH (officer:Officer)<-[investigate:INVESTIGATED_BY]-(crime:Crime)
MATCH (crime)-[occurredAt:OCCURRED_AT]->(location:Location)-[hasPostCode:HAS_POSTCODE]->(postcode:PostCode)
MATCH (location)-[locationInArea:LOCATION_IN_AREA]->(area:Area)
MATCH (vehicle:Vehicle)-[involvedIn:INVOLVED_IN]->(crime)
WHERE postcode.code="NE1 4AD" AND vehicle.year=2019
RETURN officer, investigate, crime, occurredAt, location, hasPostCode, postcode, locationInArea, area, vehicle, involvedIn, officer.name, officer.surname
Rewrite: Provide the names of officers who examined crimes at sites in the 'NE1 4AD' postal zone, related to vehicles registered in the year 2019.

Question: For crimes reported in area code 'DX1054' with at least three different types of objects involved, provide the description of those objects.
Cypher:
MATCH (crime:Crime)-[occurredAt:OCCURRED_AT]->(location:Location)-[locationInArea:LOCATION_IN_AREA]->(area:Area)
MATCH (object:Object)-[involvedIn:INVOLVED_IN]->(crime)
WHERE area.areaCode="DX1054"
WITH crime, COUNT(DISTINCT object.type) AS objectTypes, COLLECT(object.description) AS descriptions
WHERE objectTypes >= 3
RETURN crime, occurredAt, location, locationInArea, area, involvedIn, object, descriptions

Question: Provide details of any objects used in crimes resolved as 'charged' where the investigating officer is ranked 'Sergeant' and the crime was reported in the postcode 'AB10 1AB'.
Cypher:
MATCH (officer:Officer)<-[investigate:INVESTIGATED_BY]-(crime:Crime)-[used:INVOLVED_IN]->(object:Object)
MATCH (crime)-[located:OCCURRED_AT]->(location:Location)-[postcodeRelation:HAS_POSTCODE]->(postcode:PostCode)
WHERE officer.rank="Sergeant" AND crime.last_outcome="charged" AND postcode.code="AB10 1AB"
RETURN officer, investigate, crime, used, object, located, location, postcodeRelation, postcode, object.id, object.type, object.description

Question: Are there any familial connections between suspects involved in crimes at locations through postcode 'CB2 1TN' with Officer 'Blake Johnson' under investigation?
Cypher:
MATCH (officer:Officer)<-[investigate:INVESTIGATED_BY]-(crime:Crime)
MATCH (crime)-[located:OCCURRED_AT]->(location:Location)-[hasPostcode:HAS_POSTCODE]->(postcode:PostCode)
MATCH (suspect1:Person)-[part1:PARTY_TO]->(crime)
MATCH (suspect1)-[familyRel:FAMILY_REL]->(suspect2:Person)-[part2:PARTY_TO]->(crime)
WHERE officer.name="Blake" AND officer.surname="Johnson" AND postcode.code="CB2 1TN"
RETURN officer, investigate, crime, located, location, hasPostcode, postcode, part1, suspect1, familyRel, suspect2, part2
Semantic-EQL-Question: What are the familial relationships between suspects in crimes located in the CB2 1TN postcode area that were handled by Officer Blake Johnson?
Rewrite: Are there any family ties among suspects involved in criminal activities at locations within the postcode 'CB2 1TN' being investigated by Officer 'Blake Johnson'?

Question: What type of familial relationships exist among persons associated with 'email@testdomain.com' who are involved in confirmed cases of theft?
Cypher:
MATCH (email:Email)<-[:HAS_EMAIL]-(person:Person)-[family_rel:FAMILY_REL]->(related_person:Person)
MATCH (person)-[:PARTY_TO]->(crime:Crime)
WHERE email.email_address="email@testdomain.com" AND crime.type="theft" AND crime.last_outcome="confirmed"
RETURN person, related_person, family_rel, family_rel.rel_type
Corrected-Cypher:
MATCH (email:Email)<-[relation4:HAS_EMAIL]-(person:Person)-[family_rel:FAMILY_REL]->(related_person:Person)
MATCH (person)-[relation6:PARTY_TO]->(crime:Crime)
WHERE email.email_address="email@testdomain.com" AND crime.type="theft" AND crime.last_outcome="confirmed"
RETURN relation6, relation4, crime, email, person, related_person, family_rel, family_rel.rel_type
Rewrite: What familial connections are there among individuals linked to 'email@testdomain.com' who have participated in verified theft incidents?

Question: How are the vehicles involved in multiple incidents of vandalism related to each other through their registered owners in the area coded 'G1 1XX'?
Cypher:
MATCH (vehicle1:Vehicle)-[involve1:INVOLVED_IN]->(crime1:Crime)
MATCH (vehicle2:Vehicle)-[involve2:INVOLVED_IN]->(crime2:Crime)
MATCH (owner1:Person)-[has_phone1:HAS_PHONE]->(phone1:Phone)<-[:HAS_PHONE]-(owner2:Person)
MATCH (crime1)-[occurred_at1:OCCURRED_AT]->(location1:Location)<-[current_address1:CURRENT_ADDRESS]-(owner1)
MATCH (crime2)-[occurred_at2:OCCURRED_AT]->(location2:Location)<-[current_address2:CURRENT_ADDRESS]-(owner2)
MATCH (location1)-[has_postcode1:HAS_POSTCODE]->(postcode1:PostCode)-[postcode_in_area1:POSTCODE_IN_AREA]->(area1:Area)
MATCH (location2)-[has_postcode2:HAS_POSTCODE]->(postcode2:PostCode)-[postcode_in_area2:POSTCODE_IN_AREA]->(area2:Area)
WHERE crime1.type = "vandalism" AND crime2.type = "vandalism" AND area1.areaCode = "G1 1XX" AND area2.areaCode = "G1 1XX"
AND vehicle1<>vehicle2 AND owner1<>owner2 AND crime1<>crime2
RETURN vehicle1, involve1, crime1, occurred_at1, location1, current_address1, owner1, has_phone1, phone1, 
       vehicle2, involve2, crime2, occurred_at2, location2, current_address2, owner2, 
       has_postcode1, postcode1, postcode_in_area1, area1, 
       has_postcode2, postcode2, postcode_in_area2, area2
Semantic-EQL-Question: Who are the respective owners of two different vehicles linked to separate acts of vandalism in the same area "G1 1XX", and what are their connections through phone ownership?
Corrected-Cypher:
MATCH (vehicle1:Vehicle)-[involve1:INVOLVED_IN]->(crime1:Crime)
MATCH (vehicle2:Vehicle)-[involve2:INVOLVED_IN]->(crime2:Crime)
MATCH (owner1:Person)-[has_phone1:HAS_PHONE]->(phone1:Phone)<-[relation16:HAS_PHONE]-(owner2:Person)
MATCH (crime1)-[occurred_at1:OCCURRED_AT]->(location1:Location)<-[current_address1:CURRENT_ADDRESS]-(owner1)
MATCH (crime2)-[occurred_at2:OCCURRED_AT]->(location2:Location)<-[current_address2:CURRENT_ADDRESS]-(owner2)
MATCH (location1)-[has_postcode1:HAS_POSTCODE]->(postcode1:PostCode)-[postcode_in_area1:POSTCODE_IN_AREA]->(area1:Area)
MATCH (location2)-[has_postcode2:HAS_POSTCODE]->(postcode2:PostCode)-[postcode_in_area2:POSTCODE_IN_AREA]->(area2:Area)
WHERE crime1.type = "vandalism" AND crime2.type = "vandalism" AND area1.areaCode = "G1 1XX" AND area2.areaCode = "G1 1XX"
AND vehicle1<>vehicle2 AND owner1<>owner2 AND crime1<>crime2
RETURN relation16, vehicle1, involve1, crime1, occurred_at1, location1, current_address1, owner1, has_phone1, phone1, vehicle2, involve2, crime2, occurred_at2, location2, current_address2, owner2, has_postcode1, postcode1, postcode_in_area1, area1, has_postcode2, postcode2, postcode_in_area2, area2
Rewrite: How are the vehicles, which have been part of several vandalism cases, connected through the registration of their owners in the 'G1 1XX' zone?

Question: Can you describe the relationship dynamics among individuals involved in crime labeled '12345ABCDE' and also linked to phone calls made on 12th March 2023?
Cypher:
MATCH (crime:Crime {id: "12345ABCDE"})<-[party:PARTY_TO]-(person:Person)
MATCH (person)-[hasPhone:HAS_PHONE]->(phone:Phone)<-[callerRel:CALLER]-(call:PhoneCall)
WHERE call.call_date = date("2023-03-12")
RETURN crime, party, person, hasPhone, phone, callerRel, call, person.nhs_no, person.name, person.surname, person.age
Rewrite: Could you explain the interactions among people connected to the criminal case marked '12345ABCDE' and associated with phone calls from March 12th, 2023?

Question: What kind of relationship exists between criminal suspects and witnesses who live within the same location as 'London Post Area'?
Cypher:
MATCH (location:Location)-[:HAS_POSTCODE]->(postcode:PostCode)-[:POSTCODE_IN_AREA]->(area:Area)
MATCH (suspect:Person)-[:PARTY_TO]->(crime:Crime)-[:OCCURRED_AT]->(location)
MATCH (witness:Person)-[:PARTY_TO]->(crime)
WHERE area.areaCode="London Post Area" AND suspect<>witness
RETURN suspect, witness, crime, location, postcode, area, location.address, suspect.nhs_no, suspect.name, suspect.surname, suspect.age, witness.nhs_no, witness.name, witness.surname, witness.age
Corrected-Cypher:
MATCH (location:Location)-[relation6:HAS_POSTCODE]->(postcode:PostCode)-[relation7:POSTCODE_IN_AREA]->(area:Area)
MATCH (suspect:Person)-[relation8:PARTY_TO]->(crime:Crime)-[relation9:OCCURRED_AT]->(location)
MATCH (witness:Person)-[relation10:PARTY_TO]->(crime)
WHERE area.areaCode="London Post Area" AND suspect<>witness
RETURN relation10, relation9, relation8, relation7, relation6, suspect, witness, crime, location, postcode, area, location.address, suspect.nhs_no, suspect.name, suspect.surname, suspect.age, witness.nhs_no, witness.name, witness.surname, witness.age
Rewrite: What is the nature of the interaction between criminal suspects and witnesses residing in the same 'London Post Area'?

Question: Identify any existing family relationships among individuals who have participated in crimes involving drugs in the 'SE1 2AA' area and lived at address linked with postcode 'SE1 2BB'.
Cypher:
MATCH (crime:Crime)-[occurred_at_rel:OCCURRED_AT]->(location:Location)-[has_postcode_rel:HAS_POSTCODE]->(postcode:PostCode)-[postcode_in_area_rel:POSTCODE_IN_AREA]->(area:Area)

MATCH (person_current_address:Person)-[current_address_rel:CURRENT_ADDRESS]->(current_location:Location)-[current_has_postcode_rel:HAS_POSTCODE]->(current_postcode:PostCode)
MATCH (person)-[family_rel:FAMILY_REL]->(related_person:Person)
WHERE crime.type CONTAINS "drugs" AND area.areaCode = "SE1 2AA" AND current_postcode.code = "SE1 2BB"
RETURN crime, occurred_at_rel, location, has_postcode_rel, postcode, postcode_in_area_rel, area, person, part_to_rel, person_current_address, current_address_rel, current_location, current_has_postcode_rel, current_postcode, related_person, family_rel, family_rel.rel_type
Semantic-EQL-Question: Can you identify the family connections of individuals linked to drug crimes occurring in the SE1 2AA area, but residing in SE1 2BB?

MATCH (postcode:PostCode {code: "W2C 4DB"})<-[:HAS_POSTCODE]-(location:Location)<-[:CURRENT_ADDRESS]-(person:Person)-[:PARTY_TO]->(crime:Crime {type: "theft"})

Question: Can you calculate the total number of vehicle-related crimes investigated by each officer in the 'N2 1AC' area for the year 2020?
Cypher:
MATCH (officer:Officer)-[investigated:INVESTIGATED_BY]-(crime:Crime)-[occurred:OCCURRED_AT]->(location:Location)-[in_area:LOCATION_IN_AREA]->(area:Area {areaCode: "N2 1AC"}),
      (crime)-[involved:INVOLVED_IN]->(vehicle:Vehicle)
WHERE crime.date.year = 2020
RETURN officer.name, officer.surname, COUNT(crime) AS TotalVehicleRelatedCrimes
Corrected-Cypher:
MATCH (officer:Officer)-[investigated:INVESTIGATED_BY]-(crime:Crime)-[occurred:OCCURRED_AT]->(location:Location)-[in_area:LOCATION_IN_AREA]->(area:Area {areaCode: "N2 1AC"}),
      (crime)-[involved:INVOLVED_IN]-(vehicle:Vehicle)
WHERE crime.date.year = 2020
RETURN officer.name, officer.surname, COUNT(crime) AS TotalVehicleRelatedCrimes
Rewrite: Could you determine the cumulative count of vehicle-related crimes each officer examined in the 'N2 1AC' area during the year 2020?

Question: How many different crime types have been reported from locations within the 'B3 2BB' postcode area over the last five years?
Cypher:
MATCH (postcode:PostCode {code: "B3 2BB"})-[:POSTCODE_IN_AREA]->(area:Area)<-[:LOCATION_IN_AREA]-(location:Location)<-[:OCCURRED_AT]-(crime:Crime)
WHERE crime.date >= date({years: date().year - 5})
RETURN DISTINCT crime.type, COUNT(crime) AS countOfType
Corrected-Cypher:
MATCH (postcode:PostCode {code: "B3 2BB"})-[relation4:POSTCODE_IN_AREA]->(area:Area)<-[relation5:LOCATION_IN_AREA]-(location:Location)<-[relation6:OCCURRED_AT]-(crime:Crime)
WHERE crime.date >= date({years: date().year - 5})
RETURN DISTINCT crime.type, COUNT(crime) AS countOfType
Rewrite: Over the past five years, how many distinct types of crime have been recorded in the 'B3 2BB' postcode area?

Question: Determine the sum of charges relating to vehicle theft in the areas under postcode 'EC3N 4AB' for crimes that occurred between 2019 and 2022.
Cypher:
MATCH (crime:Crime)-[:OCCURRED_AT]->(location:Location)-[:HAS_POSTCODE]->(postcode:PostCode {code: "EC3N 4AB"})
WHERE crime.type = "Vehicle Theft" AND crime.date.year >= 2019 AND crime.date.year <= 2022
RETURN SUM(crime.charge)
Corrected-Cypher:
MATCH (crime:Crime)-[relation3:OCCURRED_AT]->(location:Location)-[relation4:HAS_POSTCODE]->(postcode:PostCode {code: "EC3N 4AB"})
WHERE crime.type = "Vehicle Theft" AND crime.date.year >= 2019 AND crime.date.year <= 2022
RETURN SUM(crime.charge)
Rewrite: Calculate the total charges associated with vehicle theft in regions with the postcode 'EC3N 4AB' for crimes committed from 2019 to 2022.

Question: How many emails are registered to individuals who have been associated with more than three crimes as a suspect in postcode region 'SW1Y 4TE'?
Cypher:
MATCH (postcode:PostCode {code:"SW1Y 4TE"})<-[:HAS_POSTCODE]-(location:Location)<-[:CURRENT_ADDRESS]-(person:Person)-[:HAS_EMAIL]->(email:Email),
      (person)-[:PARTY_TO]->(crime:Crime)
WHERE crime.type = "Suspect"
WITH person, email, COUNT(crime) AS involvedCrimeCount
WHERE involvedCrimeCount > 3
RETURN COUNT(DISTINCT email)
Corrected-Cypher:
MATCH (postcode:PostCode {code:"SW1Y 4TE"})<-[relation5:HAS_POSTCODE]-(location:Location)<-[relation6:CURRENT_ADDRESS]-(person:Person)-[relation7:HAS_EMAIL]->(email:Email),
      (person)-[relation8:PARTY_TO]->(crime:Crime)
WHERE crime.type = "Suspect"
WITH person, email, COUNT(crime) AS involvedCrimeCount
WHERE involvedCrimeCount > 3
RETURN COUNT(DISTINCT email)
Rewrite: How many email addresses are linked to people identified as suspects in more than three criminal incidents within the 'SW1Y 4TE' postcode area?
